properties.name: Bay Park Road Elevation (East, West, North Boulevards)
properties.description: Raised and improved roads to mitigate chronic flooding, installed 17 tidal check valves, bioswales, and rain gardens
properties.funding: HUD CDBG-DR ($125M Living with the Bay program)

properties.name: Baldwin Drainage Upgrades
properties.description: Storm drain improvements and tidal check valves to reduce flooding

properties.name: Bellmore-Wantagh Street Elevation
properties.description: Low-lying streets elevated with new storm drains to reduce tidal flooding

properties.name: Merrick Drainage Improvements
properties.description: Storm sewer upgrades and tidal check valves

properties.name: Seaford Street Elevation & Shoreline Protection
properties.description: Road raising, new storm drains, and timber/vinyl bulkhead at Anchor Place

properties.name: Woodmere Drainage & Street Elevation
properties.description: Street elevation and storm drain improvements in Five Towns area

properties.name: Oceanside Stormwater Improvements
properties.description: Larger storm drain pipes, additional catch basins, and pump stations

properties.name: Baldwin Park Living Shoreline
properties.description: Replacing failing timber bulkhead with natural living shoreline, tidal wetlands, marsh grasses, shrubs, and upland trees

properties.name: Middle Hempstead Bay Living Barrier Reef
properties.description: Artificial oyster reef using recycled shells from restaurants to dampen waves, reduce erosion, and improve water quality
properties.funding: Town funds + NGO partnerships (CCE, Operation SPLASH)

properties.name: Hempstead Bay Marsh Restoration (Mill River)
properties.description: Create 200 linear feet of living shoreline and restore 9 acres of tidal marsh using thin-layer sediment deposition
properties.funding: NOAA National Coastal Resilience Fund ($10M + $5.76M match)

properties.name: Pearsalls Hassock Marsh Restoration
properties.description: Re-establish historic elevations, fill ditches, construct living shoreline edges

properties.name: South Black Banks Hassock Restoration
properties.description: Stabilize eroding marsh and improve habitat through elevation restoration

properties.name: Long Beach Barrier Island Dune System
properties.location: Long Beach Island (Point Lookout to East Rockaway Inlet)
properties.description: 7-mile continuous dune (~16 ft elevation), raised beach berm (~5 ft), 4M cubic yards of sand, new groins
properties.funding: U.S. Army Corps + Federal Sandy Relief (~$150M)

properties.name: Point Lookout Stone Revetment
properties.description: 2,000 linear feet of stone revetment and shoreline stabilization

properties.name: South Shore Water Reclamation Facility (Bay Park Plant) Hardening
properties.description: Earthen berm and floodwall (500-year flood level), tidal flood gates, elevated pumps and electrical systems

properties.name: Bay Park Conveyance Project
properties.description: Divert 50M gallons/day of treated wastewater from Hempstead Bay to improve water quality and marsh health

properties.name: Long Beach Wastewater Plant Consolidation
properties.description: Convert to hardened pump station with backup power and flood barriers, elevate sewer pump stations above 500-year surge

properties.name: Mill River Greenway
properties.description: Greenway route with stormwater management features and bioretention

properties.name: Smith Pond & Hempstead Lake Upgrades
properties.description: Stormwater park and habitat improvements at headwaters of Mill River
